content.rendered:
What is Vraylar?

Vraylar is a newer antipsychotic medication, approved for use in the United States by the FDA in 2015. It is mainly used to treat bipolar disorder I. It helps treat both mania and depression.

Its chemical name is cariprazine. As a newer medication, it is not available in generic form.

Find a healthcare provider now

About the Vraylar healthcare provider finder

A doctor-patient relationship is essential, especially when it comes to mental health. To assist with this process, Vraylar.com has created several tools to help you find a doctor that can determine if Vraylar is right for you.

Since Vraylar is a new medication, it can be helpful to work with a healthcare provider who has experience prescribing this medication. The healthcare provider finder tool connects you to local doctors and allows you to book and attend virtual appointments to discuss your treatment options. The tool also filters your results by specialty, type of provider, and insurance coverage.

The Doctor Discussion Guide can also support you as you begin the conversation with your healthcare provider. Based on three short sections, the guide is flexible enough to be tailored to include only the questions you are interested in discussing. You can then print the results or receive them via email.

Vraylar.com  has additional information on Vraylar, how it works, who it is for, how to take it, and what side effects you may experience. In addition, there is a pricing and savings section that may assist you when determining how to pay for Vraylar. Other helpful resources include a mood tracker and My Mood Matters, which delivers tools and information straight to your inbox.

The website and tools and website are provided by AbbVie, a pharmaceutical company involved in the distribution of Vraylar.

excerpt.rendered: Find a healthcare provider who has experience prescribing Vraylar.
